page.title: 05FARMING 2 FELSTED PLACE FM.
page.content: {Felsted Place Farm}belongs to Mr. Crawford. He has been there for 55 years. There are 15,000 acres of land and each acre would cost about Â£1,500 to buy.He employs two men. The main crops this year are rape and wheat.The rape is grown for oil and in late Spring many of the fields are bright yellow with rape flowers. Wheat is grown for the grain which is sent away to be made into flour. Mr. Crawford has two tractors which are quite old.He has three barns. There were four, but one burnt down in 1984 and he lost a lot of straw in the fire.
